repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Letter from Women's Trade Union League (London, England) to trade unionists throughout England on behalf of the Women Chain Makers at Cradley Heath.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Women's Trade Union League (London, England) to trade unionists throughout England on behalf of the Women Chain Makers at Cradley Heath regarding a lock-out, dated August 27, 1910.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Women's Trade Union League Letter #5151m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Women's Trade Union League, founded in 1874 and known until 1890 as the Women's Protective and Provident League, was a British organization promoting trade union for women workers. It was established by Emma Paterson, who had seen unions managed by working women in America.
